title: Solution to the annoying bot friend requests.
body:
All we need to do is require a captcha to send a friend requests. Real players send few enough requests that it would not be overly annoying, and it would prevent the bots from sending the requests.

Upvote to end the robot tyranny!


Edit:  For people saying it would be annoying, think about how often you actually send friend requests.  You already have to type their username, what are a few extra letters?   This wouldn't need to apply to adding people after a game, because that is not where the issue comes from.

replies.body: but humans hate captchas just as much as bots...

I hate having to type my password every time but I understand that it is a necessary sacrifice.  I'm willing to type a few letters on rare occasions to stop frequent harassment.    I imagine most would agree.

Xerfer, I wouldn't conclude JUST YET that spams on League are coming from the borderline sweatshops of Indian Information Technology. Why don't we implement first, and then see...

I mean honestly, how hard can it be to add a simple captcha as a temporary partial solution to the problem? Put one employee on captchas for a day and then brainstorm out a more effective solution later.
you're probably right, i just hate captcha

um no, please no, is it really that annoying to just hit x that we need super annoying captcha.... 


I'd rather have list of people who recently friended you so that you can send in spam report, when spam report levels get high they should be sent off for review. Or have a report spam button on chat windows.

Your solution is bad. The entire plan revolves around letting you get spammed from one fake user X times, then they have to make a new "FREE" bot account.

So you still get them, just from more varied ign's

Captcha was designed to stop botting...it works all over the internet. Much better solution as it will actually deter the original spam AND further spam.

I understand what captcha was designed to do, but I just find it annoying, and incidentally, it will only stop a few of the spammers...

lol. ok. i'm not sure u understand how this works.

You are correct, I misinterpreted it to be a program solving the captchas.  if it is humans then it is not the topic at hand and therefor a non-issue.  At the current time is computers sending the requests, not humans.  When or if that shift is made a new solution can be crafted.
...uh...i still don't think you quite understand how these captcha farms work...
A better solution that doesn't make people furiously annoyed is to just not let accounts under level 5 send friend requests.
Then how do I play with my friends that are new to the game.  The idea is to put an end to the bots, not alienate new players.
But what if it was where only the under level 5 players couldn't SEND requests, but other players above level 5 could send requests to them?

> But what if it was where only the under level 5 players couldn't SEND requests, but other players above level 5 could send requests to them?

Ditto, problem solved.

Although there's another problem here. You might see more frequent game botting to level 5 with this solution. Don't you get exp in custom matches? I could easily see someone bot spam 1v1 vs "normal" ai custom matches to level 5 and then start friend requesting. No one's gonna catch and report you in your own personal custom matches, although thank goodness they won't be ruining normals for everybody if they do this.

Solution? CAPTCHA'S FOR EXP. Okay... that passes the line of overkill annoying. I only mention it to inspire someone to make a captcha parody youtube vid. If it includes a moba player having to type in a captcha before using an ability, the narrative would be hilarious.

P.S. I'm getting 4 or 5 of these requests a day recently. Wasn't getting ANY a few weeks ago, and it's been steadily rising since then. What the heck is going on?

Well you get xp if it's a full 5v5 in customs, though I'm pretty sure it's a very small amount. I don't feel like they'd even go through the hassle of leveling them up, but I don't really know how that works so I may be wrong.

I used to get around 1 every few weeks since I joined, but lately it's been 4 a day. No clue as to why, but it seems to be a problem for everyone with all the threads being posted lately. :P Also, I used to be able to accept it and then block he user. Now when I accept it I don't have enough time to block the account. Don't know why that changed.

you now need to have at least half the maximum players for a map as human in a custom game for it to grant xp

Honestly, I don't think making them wait until level 5 for that is a bad idea. People get pushed into normal 5v5s way before they're ready. Maybe you personally would or wouldn't expect them to start at level 3, but experienced players get bored of the bots in like 1-2 games.
That would work too.
